snippet: In a report to Beijing, the city’s chief executive, Leung Chun-ying, dismisses the idea of letting the public nominate candidates for his job, a key proposal of many pro-democracy groups.
abstract: Hong Kong chief executive Leung Chun-ying, presenting major report on revamping electoral system, says mainstream opinion in city is opposed to the direct nomination for chief executive candidates; item was key proposal of many pro-democracy groups.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ALAN WONG

lead_paragraph: In a report to Beijing, the city’s chief executive, Leung Chun-ying, dismisses the idea of letting the public nominate candidates for his job, a key proposal of many pro-democracy groups.

headline.main: Hong Kong Leader Says ‘Mainstream’ Opposes Direct Nominations
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong: ‘Mainstream’ Opposes Direct Nominations, Official Says
